recordings.rmk: The original file was converted from wav. to mp3. format, recorded with a ZOOM H1 audio recorder. A familiar group of 5 individuals crossing a clearing zone inside cloud forest. In the moment of the record the birds was perched in a tree at four - five meters above thhe ground.

recordings.rmk: Mostly 2 birds of group of 3-4. Recorded at 08:15, 09:20, 10:25, 11:42 and 12:40 hrs. Edge of clearing in upper montane forest. Filtered version on Moore et al. (2013) (http://johnvmoorenaturerecordings.com/pubs/ECUAD/main.htm).

recordings.loc: Napo: 'Cabañas San Isidro', 1-2 km SW Cosanga
recordings.rmk: Group of 7. Second cut at 16:07 hrs. Humid-wet forest. Reference: A: 184-212, 245-261, 347-370 (Seralbx1). Krabbe & Nilsson (2003) (ISBN 90-75838-06-9).
Se observó un grupo de aproximadamente 5 individuos de esta especie, con llamados y cantos, agitaban sus alas en ramas de un arbol desprovisto de hojas.
Se observó un grupo de aproximadamente 5 individuos de esta especie, con llamados y cantos, agitaban sus alas en ramas de un arbol desprovisto de hojas.
Se observó un grupo de aproximadamente 5 individuos de esta especie, con llamados y cantos, agitaban sus alas en ramas de un arbol desprovisto de hojas.
A small group of agitated birds possibly seeing a predator which we did not see.

recordings.loc: ECOAN Lodge, Abra Patricia, San Martin
recordings.rmk: Response to playback from a group of 5 birds (same as in XC144637) perched about 5m up in Cecropia in disturbed road-edge woodland.

recordings.loc: ECOAN Lodge, Abra Patricia, San Martin
recordings.rmk: Response to playback from a group of 5 birds (2 on mic) perched about 5m up in disturbed road-edge woodland. When flying in, they coasted like jays with shallow wingbeats when flapping. After this cut, they departed upslope to join the remainder of the flock.
after playback

natural vocalization; calls from one of a flock of seven.  Photo by Sam Woods: img:http://ibc.lynxeds.com/files/imagecache/photo_940/pictures/White-capped-Tanager-IMG_8922-La-Sofia-Road-Succumbios-Ecuador-2-September-2011.jpg
natural vocalization; calls from a pair of birds that were part of a flock of seven.
After playback. Single bird, not an adult male. Domestic chicken!
